A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
The Last Jedi was a colossal disappointment.  I knew I was in for a long movie when Luke tossed his Lightsaber over his shoulder.  The last scene in The Force Awakens was a dramatic cliffhanger\, and then just like Luke chucking his Lightsaber\, Rian Johnson chucked any direction this movie should have gone in.

The humor was forced and campy.  I hated the flying Leia scene and I have to believe Carrie Fisher would have too.  Poor Carrie and Mark Hamill\, they deserved to reprise their beloved characters in such a better style than this poor script allowed.

I liked the direction they were taking Rey.  You can see that she is conflicted and her scenes with Ren were the best in the movie.  I was kind of hoping she would go to the dark side\, she was obviously flirting with it and I thought it would have made this movie more interesting.

The scene I really didn't care for was the Casino.  This scene and the rest of the movie seemed to make a mockery of Finn's character.  It was as if the director didn't know how to fit him in to this movie so he just wrote a new character (Asian lady) and sent them on a pointless mission to this planet.  They free some kept animals because the Asian lady wants to stick it to rich people.  This whole scene was dumb and full of propaganda.  I really thought it dragged the rest of the movie down.

I liked the final scene.  It was remniscent of the battle on Hoth\, so maybe because it had undertones of an actual Star Wars movie is the reason I liked it.  

I would say that diehard fans are not going to like this movie.  It lacks the continuity and "feel" of Star Wars.  If you see it as a casual consumer of Star Wars\, it is entertaining enough.  Just not up to par with SW legacy.
